CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in New Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 8, 1967, pg. 17, reads: "Slum Marches: Demonstrations such as this one in Pittsburgh, Pa., recently, highlight the extreme intensity of the situation of critical housing need. The right to a decent place to live as advanced by the Federal Government, has been stressed with the idea of ownership as a means of instilling pride and personal dignity in lives of the masses.  The above is recall of anti-slum picketing in Pittsburgh, Pa., earlier this year, in which (from left) the Revs. James Robinson, Oliver Simms, James Cayce and William Johnson participated."
TitMainTitle: Protesters, including Rev. Donald McIlvane, and other ministers, picketing slum housing in front of Rittle Rosfeld Real Estate Company, East Street near intersection of Shawano, with Weimer Tire, Four Roses billboard, and Veebee's Cafe in background, North Side
